text: One of the best hotels, all perfect staff friendly very quiet and facilities high quality
I am in love with this hotel. I was there last year but I still want to go soon again. I totally recommend it.
Nice clean rooms. Swimming pool is beautiful too. Staff is nice. Book early as it can be quite busy during tourist season especially March and April
Awesome place to stay and eat. I recommend.

Came here three times and I’ll go back 100 times. My fave hotel in Marrakech. The owner is very nice, the food is good and the rooms are clean.

PS: It’s best to have your own car if you stay at this hotel..

Beautiful place with pool but far from everything. You need to grab a taxi and they charge foul price because they are in front of the hotel all day long. So if you have a small budget, walk a little bit and you'll be in good business ! The room maid are on a weird schedule like they took the towels in the morning and they did the room 4 hours after..... Sometimes, we returned around 4:30 PM and the room wasn't ready.... If you leave for the day, it's good though. Overall, our stay was very comfortable and relaxing so we enjoyed it !
The hotel is super clean, the food is tasty and the employees and polite and helpful, what else can I ask for! I definitely recommend it, as I’ve had an amazing experience here!

All of the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Most are relatively fluent in English, and although some of the staff may not be, they can understand basic English. The rooms are spacious, nicely designed and are all air conditioned. The pool is easily accessed via the front of the hotel or through an outside door, and there is also a smaller kids pool. There are smoking areas available, such as the balconies, the bar and the pool side. The restaurant and the bar are averagely priced, although there is only a small menu available, and not all of the food options are available throughout off-peak seasonal times.

Comfortable, modern. Wifi in the rooms. The rooms are rather small. The food is standard hotel buffet style.  Adequate but nothing to get excited about. One man on reception was very ill-mannered. I was arranging currency exchange with him and he started dealing with another person and then another one while only half dealing with me and virtually threw the currency at me after dealing with the later two. Inexcusable rudeness. Either he needs the sack or they should employ more receptionists. They lose a star for that.

Great hotel, staff always willing to help. Mohammed at the reception was also very cool. Lots of pool side and night activities. Tourists love the place and their pricing is quite average. Loved it so much.
It wasn’t bad because I was there for four days and I did see that they have rooms that are only for two people and we were three. It wasn’t bad.😊 I liked it, it was OK👍🏼

Hotel is far better than the Apartment building. Much better layout, and has a better display unlike the other side is only a boring building. They serve breakfast for 70MAD, which is very nice; they serve a variety of foods. All staff speak French, helpful to have a translator app or be able to speak it. Nice lobby area to chill while waiting or just. Spa is not worth spending especially the manicure which was 100MAD, she only cut the nails and thats all, no buffing etc. To be honest its is better than the apartment building as it has a better pool and sunlight to tan from, also majority services are in the hotel than the apartment

One of the worst places we ever stated. Sheets were not changed after the last guests - their hair were found on the bed. Rooms are far from clean. Damaged bathroom handles, clogged sink and bath tub.
Cancelled our stay after 2 days and took the refund for unused time. Good luck to this company with this business strategy...
Fantastic hotel with lovely staff and grounds. Very helpful at the desk, everything was clean! The restaurants and spa in the hotel were both excellent aswell.

Very nice appart hotel suitable for a family of four members. A lovely view. Interesting activities for kids. Spa and swimming pool.

Clean & nice but lack of service. Outdoor place for breakfast is better than indoor. Spent 2 days, day 1 there's an egg station but no man behind it. Talked to the mngr, but then they remove the egg, stove and everything. Day 2, there's not even an egg station. Waiting for 10 minutes just for milk for cereal. Many staffs just standing, even though guests are looking for place to sit for breakfast.

However we booked a 4-people room that was provisioned for two only, we felt like we were sneaking in our two friends although everyone had paid ! Had to ask them 4 times before getting additional towels and the two additional beds weren’t made til 1 in the morning. Irritating.

Having looked at many hotels in Marrakech, we chose to stay at Wazo Hotel. From the moment we arrived, we knew we had made the right decision. We was greeted and served at check in by Hicham, this guy was a customer service champion. He couldn't do enough and was always smiling. The room was great and had a poolside view. The balcony caught the sunshine for evening relaxation. The room were cleaned every day by Sana and Hayat, overseen by Wafa who catered for our every need. We stayed here for a week and would definitely recommend to others. The breakfast service was fantastic, tasty and plentiful. Never got bored of it during our whole stay. The on site restaurant served delicious Italian food and the pizzas were on point. The on site supermarket was also a massive convenience. The hotel has an on site exchange, so we was assured that we had enough local currency for exploring Marrakech. The hotel is far away from the hustle and bustle, but a short trip away from the local attractions. A late check out request was the cherry on the cake. Will be coming back to Hotel with the family in the near future. Viva Wazo!

There was one power cut the room smelt from the toilets and the water was turned off at least once. The food was ok but veggie options were few and sometimes what could have been vegetarian was covered in fish. Example being tomatoes with fish.

One of the Worst hotel experience I ever had.

- the bed had only one pillow per bed and I ordered extra pillows 3 times and they were not recieved until the next night when ordered it for the fifth time.

- the sound system for the restaurant music was so loud from my room that I can’t even hear my partner in my room, I had headaches I couldn’t sleep until they closed at 12:00 midnight. The receptionist couldn’t help with anything, neither fix the sound system to an acceptable level or change room.

- the air conditioning was poor and they fixed it 8 hours later.

- some nights they don’t have room service and they would say it frankly.

- Reception office are overwhelmed and they answer one out of 5 times u call.

Horrible experience.
1. Weird check-in process. My girlfriend and I arrived at Wazo by the night of 26th Dec, then we were asked to fill in a custom entry form. We were like ??? we have been staying at Morocco for 5 days and why would you even need that for hotel check in? What even more strange is, after we filled in the form and presented with our passports, the receptionist started to hand-copy our passport information! The whole check in process takes about 10-20 min, everything they did was so suspicious as if they are performing an identify theft.
2. Rude hotel staff. After we finished check in, one of the hotel staff walked us to our room, and then just stayed at our room, asking for tips.
3. Poor utilities. Sink is clogged. And the wifi signal was so bad that I couldn't even load my gmail.
4. Worst of all, the food. We had some salmon pasta and grilled fish for dinner at their restaurant and got food poisoning! My girlfriend started feeling dizzy and producing watery body waste right upon the next morning. Then in the afternoon, I began to have the same symptoms and my girlfriend started to throw up badly. She threw up for a good amount of times that afternoon, and I started puke the same day at midnight, almost passed out in the bathroom.
We booked Wazo because it is repudiated as a 4 star hotel and have a fairly good google review, but eventually we were struck by how terrible a hotel could be! And I would definitely report this food safety issue to the booking website.

I also asked the hotel if they could have a little birthday celebration for my nephews birthday which I gave notice beforehand and they agreed too. The manger of the hotel is friendly but I empathise with him because the reputation of the hotel is going to be at risk because of Hassan and his poor customer skills. The manager needs to brief him on his service otherwise I can see the business losing customers. Also another issue was regarding the taxi the hotel i booked, I gave a specific time for my taxi to arrive which was booked through the hotel. Taxi arrived 20 minutes later, I found out the reason and this was due to Hassan booking my taxi last minute, I almost missed my train because of him. Please do not see this as criticism but more of a observation.

(Translated by Google) Hotel whose major asset is the large swimming pool, far from the center but close to the bus stops to go into town: either on the main road a few hundred meters away or in front of the ben youssef high school.
Top entertainment team! Selim, Mimid and the others are very nice, welcoming and warm.
At the reception it's random, there are some people who are really very rude and others who are nicer. Very slow room service, do not hesitate to ask again several times.
The card to enter our room was demagnetized several times a day, so you had to go systematically to the reception to recharge it. Usually it was quick but once I had to wait over 10 min to recharge it because the receptionist was counting her till and didn't even look up at me. Neither hello nor smile.
The rooms are cleaned every day, but summarily. The windows (fingerprints) and the balcony floor were not done throughout the stay.
The restaurants do not offer local dishes. It is focused on Italian cuisine (pizzas, pasta, brushettas, salads). All-you-can-eat breakfast buffet at 70 dirham per person.
The +: the swimming pool, the entertainment team
The -: reception staff not always pleasant, slow room service, cleanliness of the rooms, bedding that hurts your back, choice of dishes on offer, there is no maintenance at all in the toilets of the spa / gym (I've never seen such a dirty toilet)

(Original)
Hôtel dont l'atout majeur est la grande piscine, loin du centre mais proche des arrêts de bus pour aller en ville : soit sur la grande route à quelques centaines de mètres ou devant le lycée ben youssef.
Équipe d'animation au top ! Selim, Mimid et les autres sont très sympa, accueillants et chaleureux.
À la réception c'est aléatoire, il y a certaines personnes vraiment très désagréables et d'autres plus sympa. Room service très lent, il ne faut pas hésiter à re demander plusieurs fois.
La carte pour entrer dans notre chambre se démagnétisait plusieurs fois par jour il fallait donc passer systématiquement à la réception pour la recharger. Généralement c'était rapide mais une fois j'ai dû attendre plus de 10 min pour la recharger car la réceptionniste était en train de compter sa caisse et ne levait même pas les yeux sur moi. Ni bonjour ni sourire.
Les chambres sont faites tous les jours mais sommairement. Les vitres (traces de doigts) et le sol du balcon n'ont pas été faits sur toute la durée du séjour.
Les restaurants ne proposent pas de plats locaux. C'est axé sur la cuisine italienne (pizzas, pâtes, brushettas, salades). Buffet à volonté pour le petit déjeuner à 70 dirham par personne.
Les + : la piscine, l'équipe d'animation
Les  - : personnel de réception pas toujours agréable, room service lent, propreté des chambres, literie qui fait mal au dos, choix des plats proposés, il n'y a pas du tout d'entretien dans les toilettes du spa/salle de sport (j'ai jamais vu des toilettes aussi sales)

(Translated by Google) I rented a 1 bedroom apartment, very good for a couple with two young children. The hotel and the apartments are two buildings separated by a small road. The apartment is more suitable for families since this is where the Kids club is located (free for residents) and the children's playground. There is also a children's pool and a large swimming pool. The apartments are cleaned every day by the housekeepers who also bring clean towels, toilet paper, empty the bins, make the bed ... and even the dishes. The staff is very kind. Special mention to the staff of the Kids club. These three young women are really caring, trained and kind. The children can feel it. I had confidence right away, which is very rare in my case. The Kids club is a very large space with different activity areas. And has a schedule that changes every week.
During my stay, the apart hotel was mainly frequented by families with young children, mostly MRE, who seek peace and discretion. The hotel seems rather frequented by tourists.
Each of our requests to reception were very well received.
The building has a gym and a wellness center. However, the latter was not open and you had to go to the hotel to receive treatment (so I was not there ... out of laziness?) I have never been to the hotel restaurant ( in the evening we only offer a buffet and that's not my thing ...).
Very good value for money.

(Original)
J'ai loué un appartement 1ch, tres bien pour un couple avec deux jeunes enfants. L'hôtel et les appartements sont deux bâtiments séparés par une petite route. L'appartement est plus adapté aux familles puisque c'est là que se trouve le Kids club (gratuit pr les residents) et l air de jeux pour les enfants. Il y a aussi une piscine pr enfants et une grande piscine. Les appartements sont nettoyés chq jour par les femmes de ménages qui apportent également les serviettes propres, papier WC, vident les poubelles, font le lit... et même la vaisselle. Le personnel est très gentil. Mention spéciale au personnel du Kids club. Ces trois jeunes femmes sont vraiment bienveillante, formée et gentille. Les enfants le sentent. J'ai eu tt de suite confiance, ce qui est très rare ds mon cas. Le Kids club est un très grand espace avec différentes zone d'activité. Et dispose d'un programme qui change chaque semaine.
Pendant mon séjour,  l'appart hôtel était essentiellement fréquenté par des familles avec des jeunes enfants, la plupart MRE, qui recherchent le calme et la discrétion. L'hôtel semble plutôt fréquenté par des touristes.
Chacune de nos demandes auprès de la réception ont été très bien accueillie.
Le bâtiment dispose d'une salle de sport et d'un centre de bien-être. Ce dernier n'était cependant pas ouvert et il fallait se rendre ds l'hôtel pr bénéficier des soins  (je n'y ai donc pas été... par fainéantise?) Je n'ai jamais été au restaurant de l'hôtel  (le soir on y propose uniquement un buffet et ce n'est pas mon truc. ..).
Très bon rapport qualité/prix.
